solution_line_template: {tables_half} tables have {chairs_per_half_table} chairs each for a total of {tables_half}*{chairs_per_half_table} = <<{tables_half}*{chairs_per_half_table}={chairs_from_half_tables}>>{chairs_from_half_tables} chairs

{tables_with_3_chairs} tables have {chairs_per_3_chair_table} chairs each for a total of {tables_with_3_chairs}*{chairs_per_3_chair_table} = <<{tables_with_3_chairs}*{chairs_per_3_chair_table}={chairs_from_3_chair_tables}>>{chairs_from_3_chair_tables} chairs

{remaining_tables} tables have {chairs_per_4_chair_table} chairs each for a total of {remaining_tables}*{chairs_per_4_chair_table} = <<{remaining_tables}*{chairs_per_4_chair_table}={chairs_from_remaining_tables}>>{chairs_from_remaining_tables} chairs

The total number of chairs is {chairs_from_half_tables}+{chairs_from_3_chair_tables}+{chairs_from_remaining_tables} = <<{chairs_from_half_tables}+{chairs_from_3_chair_tables}+{chairs_from_remaining_tables}={total_chairs}>>{total_chairs} chairs
